string.text:
The .45 caliber full metal jacket round has enjoyed popularity for a hundred years thanks to its ballistic performance and a relatively small propelling charge. As a result, the bullet in this round is relatively slow but highly accurate and provides considerable stopping power.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]I
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

Full metal jacket ammo for the 12.7x108mm is mainly used in machine guns such as the Russian DShK or Kord. This Soviet round is slightly longer and thicker than the American .50 BMG round, thanks to which it holds slightly more powder for ignition. The FMJ variant of the 12.7x108mm is not suitable for penetrating armors of heavily-armored vehicles (irrelevant in the Zone unless you encounter a military unit with an Mi-24 or BTR-80). It is also slightly less accurate than the AP variant, but on the other hand its price is lower.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]very high

An armor-piercing round chambered in the 12.7x108mm. The round is tailor-made for the KSVK. The 12.7x108mm AP rounds that made their way into the Zone are not suited for regular DShK or Kord as they are much more expensive than typical armor-piercing rounds. The 12.7x108mm AP is fitted with a tungsten tip, which enables the round to penetrate 25mm-thick layer of steel. These bullets are very expensive due to their special nature and should be used exclusively against the deadliest of enemies.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]V
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]very high

The 7.62x51 NATO round is a military variant of the .308 round which was used as a standard-issue by the NATO forces until 5.56 ammunition was introduced in the '70s in the Vietnam War. At present, it is most commonly employed by private military contractors all over the world. The 7.62x51 round is a very common machine gun caliber, and can also be used in sniper rifles.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]III
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

The 7.62x51 Depleted Uranium round is produced and used by private military organizations world-wide. The need to develop a DU version of this cartridge arose during large-scale private military operations against drug cartels in several countries when PMCs looked for a way to gain another edge.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

This unusual .45 ACP caliber round is comprised of a jacketed soft point bullet with a hollow steel core, possessing both their advantages and disadvantages.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]II
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]very high

Uranium round, chambered in .45 ACP. From the time of the first deployment on the battlefield, depleted uranium rounds have been the object of widespread criticism in the international community; arguments pertaining to their effects on the environment and radiation dust inhaled by the user have been very common in the fight to ban the use of DU. .45 DU uses enforced steel infused with depleted uranium. The round is self-sharpening, which enhances its armor penetrating capabilities. After impact, uranium heats up and burns; this process, however, produces no radiation. These rounds are only actively used by the US, and less effective versions are sometimes employed by other countries.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium - high

The .357 HP round is a hollow-point bullet. The purpose of the round is to slow down upon impact, which decreases its penetration, but at the same time causes larger internal tissue damage. 
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium - high

Ammunition utilizing phosphorus to burn through targets. Phosphorus-based incendiary ammunition was first produced and used during the World War I. Currently true incendiary ammunition is only utilized by a small number of groups, and can only be fired by a handful of weapons. This round used in the Zone is of mid-level quality and moderate price. It does not explode upon impact, but is highly reliable.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IIIA
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]high
 
%c[0,170,170,170]SPECIAL:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] produces tracer

The .338 Lapua Magnum is a specialized rimless bottlenecked centerfire cartridge developed for military long-range sniper rifles. The Afghanistan War and Iraq War made it a combat-proven round with ready and substantial ammunition availability. The .338 Lapua is a dual-purpose anti-personnel and anti-materiel round, but its anti-materiel potential is limited.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]high

The .338 DU is a depleted uranium round based on the .338 Lapua Magnum cartridge. Developed for use by private military contractors stationing in Iraq who were up against numerous armored targets, mainly tanks stolen from Pakistan and body armors sold by their Middle Eastern sympathizers. In a quick move to prevent insurgents from obtaining more advanced equipment, three largest private military firms launched a joint attack on weapon traders in Iraq and Tajikistan. The .338 DU round was created as a counter-measure against armored personnel involved in the blitz. This round is very rare due to the trade agreements between the companies involved in its creation, but is highly sought after by those in the private sector. 
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]V
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]high

Standard 12-caliber round filled with 6 mm shot. Highly lethal at close range. Only suitable for use with smoothbore weapons.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]none
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium - high
 
%c[0,170,170,170]SPECIAL:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] expanding cloud of pellets, short eff. range

This heavy 12-caliber slug round is normally used for hunting big game, but is also good for other purposes. Instead of piercing, this hefty slug simply crushes through armor.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]AIII
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

Military 5.45x39 7H22 caliber armor-piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. The bullet contains a hard-alloy armor piercing penetrator. Effective against body armor.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

Military 5.45x39 7H10 caliber is an improved piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. Provides better accuracy than the 7.62 caliber round thanks to reduced recoil and a 100 meter increase in range.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]AIII
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

A common NATO military 5.56x45 caliber armor piercing round, known under its SS190/M855 index, widely used by Western security agencies and special forces. Effective against body armor.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

A standard-issue NATO 5.56x45 caliber round specially designed for accurate automatic fire. Provides good ballistic characteristics, having been designed on the basis of a hunting round. Widely known under its SS109 index.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]II
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]high
 
%c[0,170,170,170]SPECIAL:
 
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] lowered piercing capability
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] enhanced fragmentation in soft tissue

A 7.62 caliber sniper round with a steel penetrator specially designed for the SVD. Unlike the machine gun round, the 7N1 provides tight groupings and excellent penetration characteristics.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]high

The 7.62x54mm N14 is an armor-piercing cartridge. The bullet has a steel core to penetrate body armor or light barriers, and a boat-tail base to increase accuracy.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]V
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]high

Cheap 7.62 caliber machine gun round. Its design makes it unsuitable for sniper rifles, so it is used only with the PKM machine gun. It is a high-powered round and thanks to a hard steel core it possesses quite good penetrative capabilities. A heavy round for a heavy gun.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]high

Cheap 7.62 PP (also known as 7.62 R) is a dated rifle caliber introduced in the Soviet Empire at the turn of the 19th century and was still used by the USSR after World War II. It was originally designed for the Mosin-Nagant standard-issue infantry rifle and is quite common in the Zone due to the popularity of the rifle. The round is relatively cheap but has surprisingly good penetrative capabilities, even in comparison to more modern ammo types. It can also be used as a cheaper solution in the PKM machine gun.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]III
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

A full metal jacket round with a steel penetrator and a lead core under a metal jacket. Provides good stopping power but is ineffective against body armor.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]II
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]low - medium

This round contains a bullet with enhanced stopping power, while its European +P+ designation indicates "overpressure ammunition" with a 30% increase in muzzle velocity. Ineffective against body armor.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]I
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium - high

RG028 is a cartridge used for its armor penetration capabilities. The goal of the RG028 was to become a counter to body armor; for this reason, it's loaded with a hardened steel core. Unfortunately, the round itself isn't much of an improvement over the standard, it just has a stronger impact than typical 9x18 round.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IIIA
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]low - medium

This basic 9x19 caliber round with a jacketed bullet has good characteristics while being simple to produce. The round is popular due to the fact that international conventions prohibit the use of expanding ammunition in combat. Ineffective against body armor.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]I
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

This 9x19 caliber jacketed hollow-point bullet with an expanding hollow has high stopping power and low ricochet propensity. Used by police and for self-defense. Ineffective against body armor due to its low penetration potential.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]I
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]high

This 9x19 caliber bullet comes with a hard steel core. Designed to enhance armor penetrating capabilities of small arms and submachine guns. Used mainly by anti-terrorist and special police units when faced with multiple enemy types.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]III
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]low - medium

The SP-6 is a subsonic armor-piercing round with a jacketed soft point bullet with a hard steel core that protrudes from the casing. Requires a silencer for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries. Effective against body armor.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium - high
 
%c[0,170,170,170]SPECIAL:
 
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] sub-sonic ammunition
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] greatly increased projectile drop with distance

The SP-5 is a subsonic rifle round with a bimetallic casing. The round contains a steel core with a gap behind it that is filled with lead. Requires a silencer for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]III
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium - high
 
%c[0,170,170,170]SPECIAL:
 
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] sub-sonic ammunition
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] greatly increased projectile drop with distance

40 mm grenade for the M203 underbarrel grenade launcher. This round has a 3.5 meter kill zone. Also suitable for use in the FN F2000 integrated grenade launcher.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Blast power: %c[0,170,170,170]medium
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Blast radius: %c[0,170,170,170]4.1 m
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Fragments' radius: %c[0,170,170,170]28 m
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Av. number of fragments: %c[0,170,170,170]95 (small shrapnels)
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Explosion delay: %c[0,170,170,170]none (explodes on impact)

Fragmentation warhead for anti-personnel warfare used with the RPG-7 grenade launcher. The main purpose of the warhead is to kill enemies in cover outside the range of hand grenades.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Blast power: %c[0,170,170,170]high
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Blast radius: %c[0,170,170,170]5.6 m
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Fragments' radius: %c[0,170,170,170]41 m
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Av. number of fragments: %c[0,170,170,170]153 (small shrapnels)
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Explosion delay: %c[0,170,170,170]none (explodes on impact)

Regular fragmentation grenade for the GP-25 Kostyor underbarrel grenade launcher. This round has a 2.5 meter kill zone. The VOG-25 grenade is also used in the OC-14 Groza complex and RG6 / 6G30 revolver-type grenade launcher.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Blast power: %c[0,170,170,170]medium
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Blast radius: %c[0,170,170,170]3.6 m
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Fragments' radius: %c[0,170,170,170]20 m
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Av. number of fragments: %c[0,170,170,170]81 (small shrapnels)
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Explosion delay: %c[0,170,170,170]none (explodes on impact)

7.62x39 M43 is an armor piercing round produced in China, which is why it's often referred to as "7.62x39 CN". This round features a mild steel core which enhances its penetration capabilities. This Chinese round (as well as all other M43 ammunition) is currently banned for import in the US because US federal law classifies the round as an armor-piercing handgun round. This classification is based on materials and bullet design rather than on empirical ability to penetrate armor.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

7.62x39 Full Metal Jacket is one the most commonly used types of ammunition, especially in Africa and in the Middle East. Some nicknamed it the "Round of the Revolution" due to its favored use by both terrorist and criminal organizations. Due to the sheer power of the round most military organizations have turned to using additional steel plates to counter 7.62x39 as there is a high probability of encountering it in combat situations.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]AIII
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

The 7.92x57 Mauser round was adopted by the German Empire and then the Third Reich. It was one of the most popular cartridges in the period of two world wars. However, nowadays, the round is primarily used for hunting and sports.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]AIII
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

7.92x57 SA is a round that was used by the British military against armored targets. It features a hardened steel core which gives it higher piercing capabilities. Used primarily for long range shots, the grain quality of this round is higher than the standard. This cartridge is supported by several sniper rifles.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Highest pierced armor class: %c[0,170,170,170]IV
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Tissue damage rating: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] selected NATO rifles
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Detachable optical scope made specifically for NATO rifles. ACOG stands for Advanced Combat Optical Gunsights and refers to a family of firearm scopes produced by the Trijicon company. Scopes of this type are usually of high quality and have an internal tritium-based reticule illumination. This particular type has a USMC-style reticule and fixed magnification of 2.0x.

Scopes of this type are usually of high quality and have an internal tritium-based reticule illumination. This particular type has a modern 'trijicon' reticule pattern and fixed magnification of 2.0x.

Scopes of this type are usually of high quality and have an internal tritium-based reticule illumination. This particular type has a USMC-style reticule and features adjustable magnification.

ACOG stands for Advanced Combat Optical Gunsights and refers to a family of firearm scopes produced by the Trijicon company. Scopes of this type are usually of high quality and have an internal tritium-based reticule illumination. This particular type has a USMC-style reticule, and features a heat-based target acquisition at close-medium range.

%c[0,170,170,170]PSO (for Pritsel Snaipersky Optichesky, "Optical Sniper Sight") is a series of Soviet-made optical scopes produced by Novosibirsk Instrument-Making Plant (NPZ Optics State Plant). In common use since 1964 when it was introduced as a standard issue telescopic sight for SVD sniper rifle. The scope has been later adapted to assault rifles such as AK-74 or AN-94. Recognized for its durability, versatility and very well-designed reticule pattern featuring convenient range-finder scale. This particular type has 5.0x magnification rate, making it usable mainly for combat at long ranges. It is attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount, which is standard in Warsaw Pact countries.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Magnification: %c[0,170,170,170]5.0x
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Condition: %c[0,170,170,170]good
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Reticule pattern: %c[0,170,170,170]PSO-1

%c[0,170,170,170]ZF-4 is one of the first telescopic sights ever created. Designed and manufactured in Germany during World War II, it was intended to provide regular infantry with the ability to fight at long distances. In the end, due to insufficient numbers produced, it has been primarily used by German snipers and elite combat squads. The scope is still in use since weapons it has been designed for are commonly available, hence it remains a relatively popular model in the Zone as well.

%c[0,170,170,170]Special version of Soviet PSO-1 scope with a reticule, designed specifically to assist in firing low-velocity, heavy bullets such as 9x39. The grid pattern and range-finder scale make it easier to compensate for increased drop and wind susceptibility of such rounds, while radioactively lit center-point increases effectiveness in low-light conditions. This set of properties makes the scope ideal for use on top of Spetsnaz-dedicated, special-purpose firearms such as OTs-14 Groza or AS VAL. It is also by standard mounted on VSS Vintorez sub-sonic sniper rifle. Although the reticule is designed specifically for above-mentioned purposes, the scope is attached using a standard dovetail mount, thus it can be installed on any Warsaw Pact rifle.

%c[0,170,170,170]Advanced rifle suppressor of US design and manufacture, which has apparently 'disappeared' from one of the US Army supply containers. It consists of hi-grade steel body filled with four extension chambers, followed by a series of Z-type titanium baffles. The unit almost completely reduces muzzle flash and considerably suppresses sound emitted when firing. It also requires minimum maintenance. Silencers of this and similar types are commonly used on all smallbore Western-made rifles and remain in active service in Western armed forces.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

%c[0,170,170,170]An effective sound suppressor for caliber 9x18 weapons. It is very archaic and yet quite effective. Its body contains a tightly-packed roll of fine brass mesh. The front of the unit comprises a set of rubber wipes with caliber-sized holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used for close-combat engagements against lightly-armored enemies and for assassinations.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]very high

%c[0,170,170,170]Very efficient, recoil-assisted suppressor designed for use on all 9mm caliber firearms. Mounted through a miniaturized Nielsen Device, it does not obscure ironsight aiming, remaining perfectly in-line with upper edge of most modern repeatable and automatic pistols. Re-designed baffle spread and careful design of initial expansion chamber ensure a very high sound reduction, while muzzle flash gets almost entirely eliminated. It requires almost none manual maintenance.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]very high

Made fully of titanium and featuring extension chamber with precisely drilled holes divided with polymer wipe from baffle segment. Designed specifically for use with OTs-14 Groza sub-sonic rifles, it provides them with a very effective means of sound suppression - making them equal in this regard to special-purpose weapons with integrated suppressors such as VSK-94.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]high

%c[0,170,170,170]Russian PBS-1 (for Pribor Bezszumnoj Strielby) sound suppressor for caliber 7.62x39 weapons. Although dated, first produced in 1950s, it is extremely effective and is still being produced as a valuable add-on to common AK-47 and AKM rifles. The suppressor is encompassed in alloy-steel cylinder and consists of a gas-exhausting expansion chamber which is followed by eleven compartments divided by ten M-type steel baffles. Originally, the suppressor contained a rubber wipe which has replaced been replaced by a hi-quality polymer counterpart that no longer requires frequent replacement. The only drawback of this silencer is that the sound suppression is not as effective as in more modern designs.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] 7.62x51 caliber weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Large, modern suppressor designed for use on Western-made rifles of medium and large caliber. It is made fully of titanium in order to both greatly increase durability and minimize point-of-impact shift. Premium sonic reduction is achieved even with forgiving baffle apertures. A new baffle design ensures better accuracy while still aggressively muting sound and flash signature. Due to fact that it has not been smuggled into the Zone in large numbers, it remains one of the more expensive firearm silencers available on the local market.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]low

%c[0,170,170,170]Larger version of a more common PBS-2 Russian suppressor. It is designed to fit large caliber weaponry such as RPK-74 or precision firearms such as SVD "Dragunov" sniper rifle. In concept, it does not differ from its smaller counterparts, but due to increased energy produced by larger-caliber round it is made of higher-quality materials. This difference is also visible in the price as PBS-4 remains one of the most expensive silencers available in the Zone.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]medium

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] .45, .338, .357 caliber weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]M100 is a result of a discarded US Army research project intended to develop a reliable flash and sound suppressor for higher-caliber rifles such as .50 or .338. Although the tests of the prototype were promising, the cost was too high to be acceptable for the purposes of mass production for regular troops. M100 design served as a basis for another model of suppressor, but it itself didn't ever see actual service. Nonetheless, a few hundred produced units suddenly "disappeared" from the warehouse they were stored in. Many of those have eventually ended up on the market in the Zone where large caliber weapons are sometimes the best choice, especially in light of constant danger prevailing in the area. Although the silencer has been designed for use on large caliber rifles, it is also quite often installed on top of .45 and .357 pistols and can almost completely suppress their shooting sounds.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]low (rifle) / v. high (pistol)

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] SVU rifles
 
%c[0,170,170,170]This specially designed three-chambered suppressor is not intended to completely silence the SVU rifle since the soldier would not be using subsonic ammunition. Its main purpose is to quiet and diffuse the noise enough to make detection by the enemy difficult. Its special feature is a very effective muzzle break placed on end of silencer, capable of reducing recoil by about 40%. Above capabilities come at the cost of reduced muzzle velocity and thus significantly lower the weapon's damage output.
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Sound suppression: %c[0,170,170,170]low
 
%c[0,170,170,170]SPECIAL:
 
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] enhanced recoil reduction

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,51,255,102]high
 
%c[0,170,170,170] The KSVK is a bullpup rifle featuring a magazine feed system that is also bolt operated. It comes with a muzzle brake and sound dampener. The weapon has a maximum range of 1500-2000 meters when the correct match grade ammunition is used in the 12,7x108mm cartridge. When loaded with 12,7x108mm armor-piercing rounds, it is capable of penetrating a brick wall as well as 25mm of steel This weapon is very rare to come by in the Zone and there are only a small handful of Spetsnaz operators and military stalkers who are able to use the KSVK to the greatest effect. The KSVK is currently used in small numbers by Russian Spetsnaz brigades, GRU as well as the MVD, and was mainly employed in Chechnya as an effective counter-sniper measure.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] POSP 8x42D scope (KVSK pattern, permanent)

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,170,170,170]medium
 
%c[0,170,170,170]A more accurate and reliable rifle than the AKM, the AK-74 is still used by the majority of countries of the former USSR. The AKS-74 is equipped with a side-folding metal shoulder stock and is designed primarily for use with air assault infantry. This particular variant of the AK-74 is using the ERDL pattern, aka the "leaf pattern". In 1948, the US Army Engineer Research and Development Laboratory (ERDL) designed a general purpose jungle camouflage consisting of mid-brown and grass-green organic shapes with black "branches" on a lime green background. This camouflage has been used by many countries and remains popular around the world.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Grenade launcher

%c[0,170,170,170]The AKS-74U was intended as a personal defense weapon for use mainly with Spetsnaz forces, airborne infantry, rear-echelon support units and armored vehicle crews that required compact but relatively powerful individual automatic weapon. This particular model of the AKS-74U is using the Bulgarian four color urban disruptive pattern. Employed by Bulgarian Air Force and Gendarmerie serving in ISAF (Afghanistan). In use since 2004.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] 5.45x39 compatible silencer

%c[0,170,170,170]The 92F is perhaps best known as the standard pistol of the US Military, which replaced the legendary M1911. It is a short-recoil operated, locked-breech weapon with an aluminum frame and a hard-chromed barrel-bore. A popular sidearm adopted by several countries. This particular model uses the US MARPAT desert camouflage. MARPAT patterns are produced thanks to highly complex fractal equations that result in a non-repeating pattern. When used in an operative environment, its textured appearance and lack of hard edges make it more effective than traditional patterns. This particular variant of the Beretta was imported into the Zone by a South African named Reon Cronje from a company called "Walco Financial Services".
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] 9x19 compatible silencer

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,51,255,102]high
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Needing a cheap, short range weapon that's effective and lethal, many rookie stalkers resort to sawing off the buttstock and barrel on the easily acquired TOZ 66. This makes the shotgun quick to wield, but at the cost of range and accuracy.

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,51,255,102]high
 
%c[0,170,170,170]The name of this shotgun is a reference to a rookie Irish stalker who went on a rampage after its acquisition. The story is often told by Owl who takes great pleasure in scaring novices with it. Reportedly, the Irishman shouted "Oh God, I fucking HATE short rifles, yet here I am FORCED to buy this fucking model! And I can't figure out why!" He ran to Beard’s bar and started screaming: "EVERYONE in this room is to blame for the STUPID design of this rifle!" Then he took aim as if he wanted to start a killing spree, only to blow his own head right off as he had turned the shotgun the wrong way out of utter disorientation... The Zone really does terrible things to the minds of good people.

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,51,255,102]high
 
%c[0,170,170,170]A powerful weapon that every stalker can afford, TOZ 66 is a close range firearm possessing both reliability and effectiveness. However, being large and unwieldy, many stalkers prefer to spend their hard earned rubles on a modern handgun instead.

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,170,170,170]medium
 
%c[0,170,170,170]The M1911 was the standard-issue side arm for the US military from 1911 to 1985. An extremely reliable and robust weapon, it's been adopted for military, police and civilian use around the world and remains a very popular firearm to this day. This particular model is using a South Vietnamese camouflage based on the US m1948 ERDL camouflage pattern. This ARVN "leaf" or "Airborne leaf" pattern is a fairly accurate copy of the US ERDL design, having the same mid-brown, russet and beige organic shapes with dark brown "branches".
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:

%c[0,170,170,170]A hand-made pistol based on the Desert Eagle design. The components are finely tuned to achieve incredible accuracy for a handgun of this type. This weapon was brought to the Zone by a stalker named Logan Williams. Disguised as a TIME photographer he managed to single-handedly enter the center of Pripyat. His current whereabouts are unknown, but he is rumored to work as an information broker specializing in all matters related to the Zone.

%c[0,170,170,170]Designed by Magnum Research, the Desert Eagle uses a gas-operated mechanism normally found in rifles. This allows the pistol to use far more powerful rounds than traditional semi-automatic pistol designs. The drawback to this weapon is its size and weight. This particular model is a custom Desert Eagle, using a variant of the tiger stripe (common since Vietnam War era) camouflage pattern of the Philippine Navy Special Warfare Group, issued since 1990.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] 11.43x23 compatible silencer

%c[0,170,170,170] The FS2000 Tactical is a civilian legal, semi-auto-only variant of the F2000 selective-fire bullpup carbine with an integrated MIL-STD 1913 top mounting rail and emergency backup folding sights. Fitted with a permanent EOTech holographic sight. Commonly used by the Slovenian Army. This particular model uses the M91 Oakleaf Pattern which has been in service since 1991. The pattern is based on the Yugoslavian M87 small oak leaf pattern, but uses different colors.

%c[0,170,170,170]The first pistol developed by the independent Ukraine (one of the former USSR republics), the Fort-12 is a blowback operated, double action pistol. The ergonomics, accuracy and magazine capacity of the Fort 12 are an improvement over the older Makarov PM. The earliest camouflage patterns produced by an independent Ukraine were variants of the Soviet-designed 1988 TTsKO (Trisvetnaia kamuflirovannaia odezhda). As with those produced during the Soviet period (and by Russia thereafter), Ukrainian factories have released several versions of the pattern incorporating varied color schemes. Unlike virtually every other former Soviet republic, Ukraine continues to wear versions of this pattern, which is the standard camouflage design of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The pattern is known as dubok (little oak) in Ukraine.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] 9x18 compatible silencer

%c[0,170,170,170]FN FAL is one of the most common and widely used small-arms in the world. It fires heavy, 7.62x51 NATO rounds making it a weapon of considerable stopping power. Originally designed by and produced in Belgian Fabrique Nationale (FN), it has subsequently been licensed to multiple countries around the globe. The rifle is available in two distinct patterns: inch and metric, both of which were used as primary battle rifles of many NATO countries during the Cold War (and for this reason the weapon was nicknamed "The right arm of the Free World"). Variant of this legendary firearm most commonly found in the Zone is the metric pattern of unknown manufacture, which features a metal grip, classic wooden stock and FN CAL-shaped handguard.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:

Some say that he was one of the few real Zoners: sheer possibility to breathe unique air of the Zone was his sole purpose of living. The weapon is heavily-customized with high quality after-market elements, and surpasses most other firearms in terms of accuracy, durability and handling properties.

%c[0,170,170,170]This is a modernized version of Austrian Steyr Stg 58 (for "Sturmgewehr 58") - a license-built rifle based on Belgian FN FAL. It features a polymer stock, handguard and pistol grip, and has been constructed with great care and only with high-quality elements. This results in lowered weight, better handling, increased durability (especially when firing in automatic mode) and significantly reduced recoil which remains the biggest drawback of most other revisions of FAL.

%c[0,153,255,255]• %c[0,140,140,140] grenade launcher M203
%c[0,153,255,255]• %c[0,140,140,140] 7.62x51 compatible silencer

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,170,170,170]medium
 
%c[0,170,170,170]This is the British inch-pattern FN FAL - Commonwealth L1A1 SLR (for "Self Loading Rifle"). It has been painted with rare Rhodesian camouflage which unequivocally indicates its African origin. Rhodesia (which has eventually transformed into modern-day Zimbabwe) was a former British colony which declared its independence in 1965. Later on, the country was torn apart by the civil war - nicknamed the "Bush War" - during which government security forces (one of the three sides of the conflict) used camouflaged L1A1s as primary battle rifles. The weapon - as all FAL 'inch rifles' - while offering increased accuracy, only allows for semi-automatic fire. Due to its Bush War origin, it also features a custom muzzle brake mounted on the barrel for the purposes of recoil reduction. It is not known how a contingent of these rifles ended up in the Zone, however - as "Rhodesian" L1A1s were specifically suited for operating in harsh environment conditions - they remain one of the most reliable firearms to be found on the local market.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,153,255,255]• %c[0,140,140,140] SUSAT series scopes
%c[0,153,255,255]• %c[0,140,140,140] grenade launcher M203

%c[0,170,170,170]A modified model of a pistol from the first half of the 20th century, which is as reliable, powerful and accurate as the original. Pistols of this series deserve their reputation as one of the best handguns of the 20th century and are in great demand in the Zone. An interesting camouflage design emerged in the 1970s for test by Polish special purpose troops. Known as the Gepard (leopard) design, this pattern incorporated black and reddish brown leopard spots on a field grey background. It is believed only the special purpose uniform was produced in this pattern, and probably only for testing purposes as the uniform does not appear to have been adopted. A similar design, however, emerged in use with special units of the Zaire Armed Forces in the late 1970s, with a variant also appearing in Chad.

%c[0,170,170,170]The uniquely designed Armsel Protecta is a rotating cylinder fed 12-gauge shotgun developed for riot control and combat. Antiquated now by the Russian Saiga-12 and the American AA-12, the Protecta was a revolutionary weapon created by the Apartheid government in the 1980s. This smoothbore combat revolver-type shotgun was intended to provide extreme firepower for militarized units. The weapon benefits from a large magazine and a high effective rate of fire, but its bulkiness and considerable weight, combined with a long reload time, are the price to be paid for these advantages. Rare in the Zone and used primarily to clear confined spaces of mutants. This particular model of the Armsel Protecta is using the common m81 woodland camouflage. The m81 woodland pattern has been one of the most duplicated and modified camouflage patterns ever designed, seeing service with military forces around the world and continuing to be worn even today.

%c[0,170,170,170]The RG-6 was used as a means to increase the firepower of the infantry during urban combat, seen in small-scale conflicts, such as the Chechen wars. This revolver-type grenade launcher uses six rifled front-loading barrels, identical to underbarrel launcher attachments. The drum is also front-loaded. Widely used for rapid suppression of enemy firing positions and, when in the open, attacking defended fixed targets or fighting particularly tough mutants.

Still, it remains one of the best, top-tier weapon systems available within the Exclusion Zone.

%c[0,170,170,170]This shortened sniper rifle is the most compact member of the SVU / Dragunov BP family of sniper rifles. Its unique feature is an automatic fire mode added to regular SVU at the special request of some customers of Russian Federation Interior Ministry. Although the weapon is generally not suited for close-combat situations, the automatic fire has proven itself to be a reliable emergency solution for exposed marksmen. Drawbacks of decreased size, i.e. lowered accuracy and lower muzzle velocity, result in decreased kinetic energy of each fired projectile. To compensate for increased recoil in auto-fire mode, SVU-A features a permanent suppressor which also serves as a very effective muzzle brake. This particular model of SVU-A used to belong to Max, the legendary guardian of Freedom.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:

It is small, highly reliable, easy to use and maintain in working order. It also suffers from several drawbacks, including short range, low firing accuracy and poor stopping power, while also losing out to modern pistols in its class in terms of weight and magazine size.

%c[0,170,170,170]The uniquely designed Armsel Protecta is a rotating cylinder fed 12-gauge shotgun developed for riot control and combat. Antiquated now by the Russian Saiga-12 and the American AA-12, the Protecta was a revolutionary weapon created by the Apartheid government in the 1980s. This smoothbore combat revolver-type shotgun was intended to provide extreme firepower for militarized units. The weapon benefits from a large magazine and a high effective rate of fire, but its bulkiness and considerable weight, combined with a long reload time, are the price to be paid for these advantages. Rare in the Zone and used primarily to clear confined spaces of mutants.

Despite its heavy weight, complex mechanism and considerable cost, it is in demand in the Zone due to its effectiveness against mutants.

It might not be good at penetrating combat armors but due to the toothed blade it is ideal at causing massive, bleeding wounds to open flesh. This is makes it a perfect choice when confronting animals, especially when finishing off already wounded ones.

%c[0,170,170,170]A rare Soviet military knife of high historic and symbolic value. Decorated with an iron emblem of a certain World War II parachute division on the wooden handle. Any stalker in possession of one of these, be it novice or veteran, is highly respected anywhere in the Zone and especially within his faction. Usually awarded for exceptional performance during missions, for example for saving a faction leader from the certain death.

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,204,0,51]low
 
%c[0,170,170,170]A well-kept Spetsnaz military knife ideal for recon class soldiers. Spetsnaz units reportedly used it to slit throats of MRBM launching sites crews few days prior to planned massive nuclear exchange in European operational theater. It is a deadly weapon and the only knife in the Zone that is relatively good at both piercing armors and dealing massive tissue damage. Ultimate melee weapon.

%c[0,170,170,170]A very durable hunting knife with a large blade of stainless steel. Ideal for handling larger animals, meat and thick hides. It is able to cause massive, bleeding wounds. Its draw-back is that it does not pierce heavy armors with adequate effectiveness.

%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Class proficiency: %c[0,204,0,51]low
 
%c[0,170,170,170]This Soviet steel knife has a 152 mm blade with a clip point, a large choil, a black wooden handle, and an S-shaped guard. The guard is "inverted" because standard Soviet Army grips called for holding the knife with the edge towards yourself. The handle is enforced with rugged fabric for a good grip. The knife is relatively small, which does not allow it to produce deep or heavy wounds, however it is specifically designed to bypass modern combat armors.

%c[0,170,170,170]The Sako M95 is a rifle of Finnish design based on the AK-47. It is a commonly-used, balanced assault rifle, possessing great damage output and predictable moveshot. Highly flexible as it can be used in a variety of combat situations, from CQC to medium ranges. Depending on the mods, the firepower, recoil and bloom recovery can be augmented, allowing it to fire in short bursts or tapping. The Sako features an abnormally high ROF for a weapon of such high damage resulting in very high DPS at the cost of some control. The weapon's fast reload can boost your chances when engaging opponents in fast-paced firefights or when you're outnumbered. For unknown reason, Sako N95 rifles which are available in the Zone are permanently equipped with PSU-1 medium-range scope.

%c[0,170,170,170]Steyr AUG A1 in standard rifle configuration (military green colour). The AUG is an Austrian bullpup 5.56mm assault rifle, designed in the 1960s by Steyr Mannlicher GmbH & Co KG (formerly Steyr-Daimler-Puch). The AUG (Armee-Universal-Gewehr—"universal army rifle") was adopted by the Austrian Army as the StG 77 (Sturmgewehr 77) in 1978, where it replaced the 7.62mm StG 58 automatic rifle (a licence-built FN FAL). In production since 1978, it is the standard small arm of the Austrian Bundesheer and various national police units. The rifle and its variants have also been adopted by the armed forces of Argentina, Australia, Malaysia, New Zealand, Bolivia, Ecuador, Ireland, Luxembourg, Saudi Arabia, Tunisia, Pakistan, and the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] 5.56x45 compatible silencer
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Permanent x2.5 Scope.
